CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1957, pg. 15, reads: "Wedding Bells Ring for Many District Couples! Mr. and Mrs. James Kelsey - 'Teenie' Harris Photo." Article reads: "PEARL - KELSEY For her marriage to James Kelsey, Miss Sandra Pearl wore a Waltz-length gown of white Chantilly lace and tulle. The daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lee Pearl, the couple plighted their troth at Nazarence [Nazarene] Baptist Church, with the Rev. W. D. Petett officiating.  Miss Velma Townes was maid of honor; bridesmaids were the Misses Joyce Claybrook, Gail Jones, Caren Saunders and Paula Pearl.  Paul Hawkins was best man.  Ushers were Willie Givens, Cecil Kelsey, Raymond Flacks, LeRoy Wilkerson and Clayburn Hally.  Craig Flacks was ring bearer and Toni Calloway, flower girl.  A reception followed at the Tioga St. home of the bride."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three men, including groom James Kelsey wearing light colored dinner jacket, and three women, including bride Sandra Pearl Kelsey wearing scalloped lace gown, posed behind dismantled three tiered wedding cake with swan decorations, possibly in basement of Nazarene Baptist Church
